# setFocusedColumn(_:)

**Instance Method**

Sets the currently focused column to the specified index.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func setFocusedColumn(_ focusedColumn: Int)
```

## Parameters

- **focusedColumn**: The index of the column to focus, or -1 if there should be no focused column.

## Discussion

This method will redisplay the previously focused column and (if required) the new `focusedColumn`.

The focused column has a focus ring drawn around the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/selectedRow] that intersects with `focusedColumn`.

You should not override this method.



## Deprecated Methods

- **focusedColumn()**: Returns the currently focused column.
- **shouldFocusCell(_:atColumn:row:)**: Returns whether the fully prepared cell at the specified row and column can be made the focused cell.
- **performClickOnCell(atColumn:row:)**: Performs a click action on the cell at the specified row and column.
- **preparedCell(atColumn:row:)**: Returns the fully prepared cell that the table view will use for drawing or processing of the specified row and column.
